intro: Aira vallesiana, commonly known as the valley aira, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
